The other team gets distracted and divided. But when they focus on their game right now, they all rally around one strategy. This unity makes it way easier to execute their game plan.

Larry has a seriously Essentialist mindset about winning and losing. He tells his players, “There’s a big difference between losing and being beaten. Being beaten means they’re just better than you—faster, stronger, more talented.” For Larry, losing is about something else. It means you lost your focus. You didn’t concentrate on what really matters. It all comes down to a simple but powerful idea: to perform at your best, you need to zero in on what’s important in the moment. 🏉

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Focusing on the present moment is essential for achieving unity and executing strategies effectively.
